Business

US economy adds 88K jobs, rate drops to 7.6 pct.

US employers added just 88,000 jobs in March, the fewest in nine months. The slowdown may signal that the economy is heading into a weak spring.

Last of the trawler men

Once-busy fishing port of Whitby, UK is now down to only a few boats. A combination of crippling fishing quotas and climate change has all but crushed the local fishing industry.
